{{other uses2 | Gabbar Singh}} {{Infobox character | color = #001 | color text = #ffa | name = Gabbar Singh | image =[[File:Amjad-khan.jpg|150px]] | caption = [[Amjad Khan (actor)|Amjad Khan]] as Gabbar Singh in ''[[Sholay]]'' | creator = [[Salim Khan]]
[[Javed Akhtar]] | portrayer = [[Amjad Khan (actor)|Amjad Khan]] | first = ''[[Sholay]]'' | last = ''[[Ramgarh Ke Sholay]]'' | country = [[India]] | nationality = Indian | gender = Male | Aliases = "Gabbar" | race = [[indian|Indian People]] | occupation = [[Dacoit]] ([[Amjad Khan (actor)|Amjad Khan]] - ''Sholay'') | title = ''Sardar'' | relations = '''Sholay''':
Hari Singh (Father) }} '''Gabbar Singh''' is a [[fictional character]] and the antagonist in the 1975 [[Bollywood|Hindi film]] ''[[Sholay]]''{{cite book|author1=Gulzar|author2=Govind Nihalani|author3=Saibal Chatterjee|title=Encyclopaedia of Hindi Cinema|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=8y8vN9A14nkC&pg=PT388|accessdate=2 October 2012|year=2003|publisher=Popular Prakashan|isbn=978-81-7991-066-5|pages=388–}}{{cite book|author=Kishore Valicha|title=The moving image: a study of Indian cinema|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=voBZAAAAMAAJ|accessdate=9 July 2013|year=1988|publisher=Orient Longman|isbn=978-0-86131-681-6|pages=68–71}} written by [[Salim Khan|Salim-]][[Javed Akhtar|Javed]], also later featured in the spoof ''[[Ramgarh Ke Sholay]]''. Played by [[Amjad Khan (actor)|Amjad Khan]], he is shown in the movie ''Sholay'' as a [[dacoit]] who leads a group in looting and plundering the villages in the region of Ramgarh. He has a sadistic personality and insists on killing whenever required to continue his status and to take revenge on his enemies.{{cite book|last=Sahai, Dissanayake|first=Malti, Wimal|title=Sholay, a cultural reading|year=1992|publisher=Wiley Eastern|isbn=81-224-0394-8}}{{cite news|last=Baghel|first=Meenal|title=Once upon a time in Ramgarh|url=http://www.indianexpress.com/Storyold/135702/|accessdate=5 December 1999}}{{cite book|last=Hogan|first=Patrick Colm|title=Understanding Indian movies: culture, cognition, and cinematic imagination|year=2008|publisher=University of Texas Press|isbn=978-0-292-72167-8|page=134}} The character of Gabbar is one of the most popular in [[hindi film|Indian films]].{{cite news|title='Sholay' completes 35 years|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2010-08-16/news-interviews/28312058_1_dacoit-gabbar-singh-film|accessdate=Nov 22, 2011|newspaper=The Times of India|date=Aug 16, 2010}} ==Development== [[Danny Denzongpa]] was the first choice of Gabbar but had to miss out because he was shooting for [[Dharmatma]] in [[Afghanistan]].{{cite news|title=Danny Denzongpa’s loss|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2008-08-30/did-you-know-/27922509_1_danny-denzongpa-bandit-feroz-khan|work=Article|publisher=The Times of India|accessdate=Nov 20, 2011|date=30 August 2008}} [[Amjad Khan (actor)|Amjad Khan]] was almost dropped from the project because [[Javed Akhtar]] found his voice too weak for Gabbar Singh's role but was later convinced. For his preparation for the role Amjad read Abhishapth Chambal, a book on Chambal dacoits written by Taroon Kumar Bhaduri (actress Jaya Bhaduri's father).{{cite book|last=Chopra|first=Anupama|authorlink=Anupama Chopra|title=[[Sholay: The Making of a Classic]]|year=2000|publisher=Penguin Books, India|isbn=0-14-029970-X}} ==Style of speech== Gabbar's language was a mixture of North Indian [[Khariboli]] and Hindi, which was something new for the audiences so the dialogues were an instant hit and are still popular in India. Javed Akhtar says that Gabbar seemed to acquire life and vocabulary of his own as he wrote the film. His sadism lies in his choice of words like "Khurach, khurach (scratch)" when he talks to [[Hema Malini]].{{cite web|author=Meenal Baghel |url=http://www.indianexpress.com/Storyold/135702/ |title=Once upon a time in Ramgarh |publisher=Indianexpress.com |date=1999-12-05 |accessdate=2011-10-23}} ==In popular culture== {{Listen |filename=Gabbar laugh.ogg |title=Gabbar Singh's famous laughter |description=From ''Sholay'' Audio cassette , performed by [[Amjad Khan (actor)|Amjad Khan]].This laugh was one of the main features of the role.{{cite web|title=80 Iconic Performances|url=http://www.filmfare.com/articles/80-iconic-performances-948.html|work=Article|publisher=[[Filmfare]]|accessdate=28 November 2011}} |format=[[Ogg]]}} Amjad shot to stardom with the movie. His mannerisms and dialogues have become an integral part of Bollywood lexicon. ''Sholay'' went on to become a blockbuster, and is the highest grossing movie in India. Although the movie boasted an ensemble cast of superstars including Dharmendra and Amitabh Bachchan, he stole the thunder with his unorthodox and eerie dialogue delivery that was perfectly opposite to the total lack of empathy his character was supposed to convey. Even after thirty five years people fondly remember his dialogues and mannerisms.{{cite news|last=Singh|first=Ruma|title=Tera kya hoga, Gabbar Singh?|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/bangalore-times/Tera-kya-hoga-Gabbar-Singh/articleshow/2161793.cms|accessdate=28 November 2011|newspaper=[[The Times of India]]|date=12 October 2006}} He later appeared in advertisements as Gabbar Singh endorsing Britannia Glucose Biscuits (Popularly knowns as "Gabbar Ki Asli Pasand"), and it was the first incidence of a villain being used to sell a popular product. The role of Gabbar singh was so deep-rooted in people's mind those days that Amjad Khan was known rest of his life by this role alone and wherever he went he had to speak some dialogues from the film to amuse the public{{cite web|url=http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0451166/ |title=Amjad Khan — IMDb}}{{cite book|last=Chopra|first=Anupama|title=Sholay, The Making of a Classic|year=2000|publisher=Penguin Books|isbn=978-0-14-029970-0|url=http://www.penguinbooksindia.com/category/Cinema/Sholay__The_Making_Of_A_Classic_9780140299700.aspx}} because the dialogues are very popular among the audiences of [[Indian Cinema]].{{cite web|title=Lines that linger|url=http://www.tribuneindia.com/2005/20050717/spectrum/main6.htm|work=Article|publisher=The Tribune|accessdate=28 November 2011}} In 2011, Amitabh Bachchan told a contestant his ''[[Kaun Banega Crorepati]]'' TV show that when Amjad Khan (a close friend of his), visited their home, his son [[Abhishek Bachchan]] ran to him and said ''papa, Gabbar singh aaya hai'' [meaning: Gabbar singh is here !!!], and Bachchan had to convince his son that Gabbar was just a character played by Khan.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5tJ1Ma2xgbo|work=Youtube.com |title=Sujata Wankhade from Maharashtra on Hot Seat-Episode 35 - KBC 2011 - 12th Oct 2011}} Gabbar Singh has been a subject of Parodies, jokes innumerable times in the popular Indian media.{{cite web|url=http://cineplot.com/amjad-khan/ |title=Amjad Khan}}{{cite web|url=http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/features/2006/11/01/1769/index.html |title=Kitne aadmi they? for the role of Gabbar Singh}} ''[[Filmfare]]'' named Gabbar Singh the most iconic villain in the history of Indian cinema,{{cite journal|url=http://www.filmfare.com/features/iconic-villains-of-indian-cinema-3038-2.html|title=Iconic villains of Indian cinema|accessdate=7 July 2013|date=3 May 2013|journal=[[Filmfare]]|author= Hashmi, Parampara Patil}} In ''[[Jai Hind (film)|Jai Hind]]'' (1994) comedian [[Senthil (actor)|Senthil]] says "Arre O Sambha" while appearing as a dacoit.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2BohprgUAjo|title=Jai Hind Comedy|publisher=YouTube|accessdate=3 November 2016}} Clip from 9:30 to 11:30. In 2012 film ''[[Gabbar Singh (film)|Gabbar Singh]]'' The character has been referenced by the protagonist Venkataratnam Naidu played by Telugu actor Konidala Kalyan Babu, he nicknamed himself after Gabbar Singh's character. In 2015 film ''[[Gabbar is Back]]'', the protagonist Ajay Singh Rajput (portrayed by [[Akshay Kumar]]) resembling Gabbar Singh and he also nicknamed himself after Gabbar's character.{{cite web|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-04-17/news-interviews/38587127_1_gabbar-ram-leela-ramana|title=After rowdy, Bhansali turns Akshay into Gabbar | date= 17 April 2013|accessdate=16 December 2013|work=Times of India}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *{{IMDb character|ch0027556}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Singh, Gabbar}} [[Category:Western (genre) film characters]] [[Category:Fictional characters introduced in 1975]] [[Category:Fictional Indian people]] [[Category:Fictional criminals]] [[Category:Fictional mass murderers]]

'''Gabi Hernandez''' is a fictional character from the American soap opera, ''[[Days of Our Lives]]''. The role was introduced by the show's then head writers [[Dena Higley]] and Christopher Whitesell on November 20, 2009. Gabriela Rodriguez won the part after successfully auditioning. However, months into her portrayal, the decision was made to age Gabi. In July 2010, it was announced that Rodriguez was replaced by former ''[[One Life to Live]]'' actress Camila Banus. Banus had previously auditioned for the role but was turned down, and rejected her first offer to return before finally accepting. She first aired on October 4, 2010.
Originally described as a sweet, innocent and loving girl, a number of events since Gabi's arrival on the series have altered her personality. Both actresses have admitted to sharing similarities with Gabi. In 2012, the character experienced a huge personality shift, which would reveal her manipulative side that was called "crazy" and obsessive. Her storylines have included the death of her sister [[Arianna Hernandez]] ([[Lindsay Hartley]]), finding out that her first love was gay, and romances with [[Chad DiMera]] ([[Casey Deidrick|Casey Jon Deidrick]], [[Billy Flynn (actor)|Billy Flynn]]) and [[Nick Fallon]] ([[Blake Berris]]). Gabi is of Latin descent, and Banus has expressed her pride to represent the Hispanic community through her portrayal. Banus' portrayal of Gabi earned her a [[Daytime Emmy Award]] nomination for [[Daytime Emmy Award for Outstanding Younger Actress in a Drama Series|Outstanding Younger Actress in a Drama Series]] in 2015.
== Casting == Gabriela Rodriguez first appeared in the role of Gabi on November 20, 2009.<ref name="SC" /> Of auditioning, Rodriguez said "It was honestly so random. I had never auditioned for a soap opera before and I was like "wow this is different. I think I want to give it a try." She seemed like such a cool girl, I was like "hey let's go for it." [...] I ended up talking with the casting director for a while and she just kind of explained to me about the character [...] The next day I got called for a callback and that was that."<ref name="Rod">{{cite web|last=Nobles|first=Omar|title=Getting To Know Gabriela Rodriguez|url=http://tvsourcemagazine.com/interviews/television/1920-getting-to-know-gabriela-rodriguez|work=TVSource Magazine|publisher=SoSource Media|accessdate=December 15, 2012}}</ref> Fellow Hispanic actress Camilla Banus had also auditioned. Banus stated "I went in and read for the role. It was actually a pretty long process. The first audition then the second audition, then I went in again to meet the casting director and the producer. They then said they wanted me for a screen test. I did the screen test and they ended up not choosing me. They ended up going with the other girl [Rodriguez]. They told me that they wanted to go a little bit younger for the part."<ref name="Casting" />
{{quote box |width = 27em |border = 1px |align=left |bgcolor= LightCyan |fontsize = 88% |quote = "So, I put it out of my mind and said ‘Days is over. Keep on moving forward’ and I did."<ref name="Casting" /> |salign = right |source =—Banus on failing to win the part following her audition}}
In July 2010, ''[[Soap Opera Digest]]'' reported that Rodriguez had been replaced by Banus.<ref name="Zap1">{{cite web|last=Bowe |first=Jillian |title=Switch-A-Roo! Gabriela Rodriguez OUT, Camila Banus IN at DAYS! |url=http://daytimeconfidential.zap2it.com/2010/07/30/switch-a-roo-time-gabriela-rodriguez-out-camila-banus-in-at-days |work=[[Zap2It]] |publisher=[[Tribune Media Services]] |accessdate=December 15, 2012 |date=August 1, 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130928061452/http://daytimeconfidential.zap2it.com/2010/07/30/switch-a-roo-time-gabriela-rodriguez-out-camila-banus-in-at-days |archivedate=September 28, 2013 |df=mdy }}</ref> The news of Rodriguez' departure came straight after [[Lindsay Hartley]], who played Gabi's on-screen sister [[Arianna Hernandez]], was killed off.<ref>{{cite web|title=Days Of Our Lives Lindsay Hartley Let Go.|url=http://soaps.sheknows.com/daysofourlives/news/id/10511/Days_Of_Our_Lives_Lindsay_Hartley_Let_Go/|work=She Knows Soaps|publisher=She Knows Entertainment|accessdate=December 15, 2012|date=August 27, 2010}}</ref> Jillian Bowe of ''[[Zap2it]]'' noted that Banus would play a "slightly older version of the role."<ref name="Zap1" /> Banus was previously best known for her role as [[Lola Montez (One Life to Live)|Lola Montez]] on ''[[One Life to Live]]''.<ref>{{cite web|title=Days Of Our Lives Nu-Gabi: Ex-OLTL's Camila Banus.|url=http://soaps.sheknows.com/daysofourlives/news/id/10755/Days_Of_Our_Lives_Nu-Gabi_Ex-OLTLs_Camila_Banus/|work=She Knows Soaps|publisher=She Knows Soaps Entertainment|accessdate=December 15, 2012|date=July 30, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://soapcentral.com/oltl/whoswho/lola.php |title=About OLTL: Who's Who in Llanview | Lola Montez | One Life to Live @ |publisher=Soapcentral.com |date= |accessdate=December 15, 2012}}</ref> Banus, who first aired as Gabi on October 4, 2010, said that the transition was "super easy" and she was welcomed onto the set with "lots of love".<ref name="SC" /><ref name="EB">{{cite web|last=Fairman|first=Michael|title=Camilla Banus & Casey Deidrick Interview – A Day of DAYS 2010|url=http://michaelfairmansoaps.com/days-of-our-lives/camilla-banus-casey-deidrick-interview-a-day-of-days-2010/2010/11/16/|work=On-Air On-Soaps|publisher=Michael Fairman Soaps, Inc.|accessdate=December 15, 2012|date=November 16, 2010}}</ref>
Explaining her being hired by ''Days of our Lives'', Banus said that two months after her initial audition she was again offered the role of Gabi by its casting director due to the character being aged, but rejected them because of other career projects. She recalled thinking "Days is over" again and "they were never going to call me again".<ref name="Casting">{{cite web|author=Sari N. Kent |url=http://thecelebritycafe.com/feature/interview-days-our-lives-camila-banus-11-08-2011 |title=Interview with 'Days of our Lives' Camila Banus |publisher=TheCelebrityCafe.com |date=November 8, 2011 |accessdate=December 15, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402150344/http://thecelebritycafe.com/feature/interview-days-our-lives-camila-banus-11-08-2011 |archivedate=April 2, 2015 |df=mdy }}</ref> Two months after this, Banus received a second call asking her to reconsider; she said "At that point I felt there was something there and that I HAD to do this, like it was something that was calling me and I said, ‘Yes.’"<ref name="Casting" /> At the 2013 [[Emmy]] ceremony, Banus revealed that she would be departing from the series when her current contract expired. Her announcement followed the news that her costars Casey Deidrick and Chandler Massey were also leaving.<ref>{{cite journal|chapter=late-breaking news|title=DAYS: CAST SHAKEUPS|page=5|work=[[Soap Opera Digest]]|publisher=[[American Media (publisher)|American Media, Inc.]]|date=July 15, 2013|volume=36|issue=28}}</ref> On April 24, 2015, it was confirmed that Banus will be reprising the role of Gabi to take part in the soap's fiftieth anniversary celebrations; Banus returned on September 17, 2015.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://soapcentral.com/days/news/2015/0424-banus_returning.php|title=Camila Banus back to Days; actress confirms return|last=Clifford|first=Kambra|publisher=Soapcentral.com|date=April 24, 2015|accessdate=April 27, 2015}}</ref>
== Character development ==
===Characterization and family=== Initially, Gabi was "sweet" and "innocent".<ref name="SDI">{{cite web|last=Deese|first=Hollie|title=Interview: Days of Our Lives’ Camila Banus|url=http://soaps.sheknows.com/daysofourlives/news/id/26237/Interview_Days_of_Our_Lives%E2%80%99_Camila_Banus/|work=She Knows Soaps|publisher=She Knows Soaps Entertainment|accessdate=December 15, 2012|date=June 23, 2012}}</ref> During an interview with ''TV Source'' magazine, Rodriguez described Gabi as "very loving", and said "even though sometimes she can come off like loudmouth and just like I guess bratty, but she's not. She's a really good girl and has a really big heart. She loves her brother and sister and would do anything for them."<ref name="Rod" /> Rodriguez said that she is sensitive, has a strong personality and shows her soft side with people she's "comfortable with", and believed these were all traits Gabi has.<ref name="Rod" /> Banus feels that she is like Gabi in the sense that she's "very, very sassy", stating "When Gabi has that kind of fiery thing, that’s totally Camila. Gabi is very motherly and likes helping the people that she loves, which is very much like me as well."<ref name="BI" /> She said that Gabi is sensitive when people say things about her.<ref name="BI" /> Gabi has three siblings: [[Rafe Hernandez|Rafe]] ([[Galen Gering]]), [[Arianna Hernandez|Arianna]] ([[Lindsay Hartley]]) and Dario Hernandez (Francisco San Martin).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://soaps.sheknows.com/daysofourlives/cast/941/Dario_Hernandez/ |title=Dario Hernandez Played by Francisco San Martin on Days of Our Lives - Soaps.com |publisher=Soaps.sheknows.com |date= |accessdate=December 15, 2012}}</ref> Rodriguez said that although they get into "little bickering fights every once in a while", the siblings love each other.<ref name="Rod" /> Banus said that compared to her three siblings, Gabi "is extremely independent, responsible and she has been on her own for a little bit", but noted that "She is a family girl and loves taking care of family."<ref name="SDI" /> She enjoys working with Galen, having stated "I love working with him. I think he’s my favorite person to work with, because we just have that brother and sister relationship."<ref name="BI" />
Banus loves playing the "evil bitch"-type character,<ref name="EB" /> and had that opportunity when Gabi underwent a personality change in 2012. [[About.com]] said that she was "the epitome of sweetness and light" but a rocky road led by finding out her first love [[Will Horton]] ([[Chandler Massey]]) was gay lead the character to undergo a "major personality switch".<ref>{{cite web|last=Di Lauro|first=Janet|title=Camila Banus on Days of Our Lives' Obsessive Gabi|url=http://daysofourlives.about.com/b/2012/07/11/camila-banus-on-days-of-our-lives-obsessive-gabi.htm|work=[[About.com|About]]|publisher=[[The New York Times Company]]|accessdate=December 15, 2012|date=July 11, 2012}}</ref>
Of Gabi's transformation from a "sweet girl" to doing terrible things, Banus said "things I think are going on in Gabi’s head that nobody gets to see". The actress who enjoys playing the "dark side of Gabi" credited Ariana's death as the reasoning for Gabi's life going downhill.<ref name="SDI" /> The actress sent a message to fans, "I want to tell them to be patient with me. The girl they once knew will come back."<ref name="SDI" /> The new Gabi was described as "obsessive and crazy" and also "manipulative" and "psycho", which received flack from fans. Banus confessed to seeing the backlash on [[social media]] websites including [[Twitter]]. She said "People say mean things, but it doesn’t really get to me at all. I’m used to it". She noted that her previous role, Lola Montez on ''[[One Life to Live]]'', was worse, stating "When I was on One Life to Live I was worse than Gabi is right now. She was a bad girl. She popped holes in [[condom]]s. That’s pretty bad. She took acid. That’s pretty bad."<ref name="BI" /><ref name="TVG" />
=== Relationship with Chad DiMera === While the role was still being portrayed by Rodriguez, Gabi had a brief romance with [[Chad DiMera]] (Casey Jon Deidrick). However, Chad left her for [[Mia McCormick]] ([[Taylor Spreitler]]). Rodriguez said that Gabi was still into him, but was "heartbroken because they really didn't have a chance at a real relationship. It was just kind of left like on the verge of something new and interesting. She was just starting to like him and she didn't know where it was going."<ref name="Rod" /> She felt that the relationship had potential, as Gabi still "might have a little thing for him".<ref name="Rod" />
{{quote box |width = 27em |border = 1px |align=right |bgcolor= LightCyan |fontsize = 88% |quote = "She sees how cute he is, and she thinks there’s something there. Plus, now they’re doing all these sexy modeling shoots wearing God knows what. Or, rather, not wearing God knows what. She wants him."<ref name="MORE" /> |salign = right |source =—Banus on Gabi's attraction to Chad during their photoshoot}}
In January 2012, the romance was re-visited in a storyline which Deidrick felt that the writers dropped their brief past, and "You'd never know that happened if you were tuning into Days for the first time now."<ref name="TVG">{{cite web|last=Logan|first=Michael|title=Is it Love — or Lunacy — For Days of Our Lives' Chad and Gabi?|url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/Love-Lunacy-Days-of-Our-Lives-1041591.aspx|work=[[TV Guide]]|accessdate=December 15, 2012|date=January 13, 2012}}</ref> Gabi and Chad became "superstar models" as the new faces of [[Countess Wilhelmina Cosmetics]]. This included a "steamy ad campaign", which Banus described as them having "no clothes and they're dripping wet. It's pretty intense."<ref name="TVG" /><ref name="MORE">{{cite web|last=Fairman|first=Michael|title=What will happen when DAYS Chad and Gabi become Supermodels?|url=http://michaelfairmansoaps.com/news/what-will-happen-when-days-chad-and-gabi-become-supermodels/2012/01/17/|work=On-Air On-Soaps|publisher=Michael Fairman Soaps, Inc.|accessdate=December 15, 2012|date=January 17, 2012}}</ref> However, Chad was in a committed relationship with [[Melanie Jonas]] ([[Molly Burnett]]) at the time.<ref name="MORE" /> ''On-Air On-Soaps'' wrote: "So will this be a case of fatal attraction? If so, Melanie better watch out, given that we have seen Banus play man-crazy when she went off the rails as ''One Life to Live''{{'}}s Lola Montez."<ref name="MORE" /> Banus felt that it wasn't love, but an infatuation, "[Gabi] is obsessed with having the ideal boyfriend because she has never had an ideal boyfriend. The person she thought was the ideal boyfriend turned out to be gay."<ref name="SDI" /> She also noted during an interview with ''[[TV Guide]]'' that "Gabi is attracted to Chad and she sees this modeling thing as a way to be near him." Everyone at the photoshoot felt that they made a good couple, while Deidrick said "Meanwhile, Chad's like, "Huh? What?" He's clueless."<ref name="TVG" /> Banus called her attraction to Chad a "rebound" from Will; Deidrick said "He's oblivious to her feelings, which is hard because Camila is such a beautiful woman."<ref name="TVG" /> Gabi was shocked to find out that Chad was dating Melanie when she showed up to the photoshoot and shared a kiss with Chad.<ref name="TVG" />
Banus said that Gabi: "sees Chad with Melanie and realizes she is not the girl for Chad. Gabi is the girl for Chad. So she focuses all her time and devotes her energy to making sure that is clear to him. At the point where they are at, I think she would do a lot to get that, and that is where she is at right now."<ref name="SDI" /> However, she noted that "Melanie, deep down, is really her friend. And honestly, she really does care about Melanie a whole lot and never wants to see her get hurt.<ref name="SDI" /> Gabi knew Melanie being kidnapped by her stalker, Andrew but didn't do anything because Andrew blackmailed her.<ref name="SC" /> Chad discovered this and has since had a bitter vendetta against Gabi, despising her.<ref name="SC" />
=== Relationship with Will Horton === [[File:Chandler Massey 4.jpg|thumb|200px|Chandler Massey ''(pictured)'' plays Gabi's "first love", Will Horton. The couple split after he came out as gay]] Following Arianna's tragic death, Gabi leaned on her sister-in-law [[Sami Brady]]'s ([[Alison Sweeney]]) son, [[Will Horton]] ([[Chandler Massey]]) for support.<ref name="SC">{{cite web|url=http://soapcentral.com/days/whoswho/gabriela.php |title=About DAYS: Who's Who in Salem | Gabi Hernandez | Days of our Lives @ |publisher=Soapcentral.com |date= |accessdate=December 15, 2012}}</ref> Of a possible Will and Gabi pairing, Rodriguez said "I think that would be so perfect. They're so compatible. They're just very good people. I think that would be fun, and I think the audience would like that."<ref name="Rod" /> Both [[virginity|virgin]]s, the couple had sex. However, Will soon lost all interest in sleeping with her again which was unsettling to Gabi.<ref>{{cite web|last=Di Lauro|first=Janet|title=Days of Our Lives Confirms Will Is Gay|url=http://daysofourlives.about.com/b/2011/11/01/days-of-our-lives-confirms-will-is-gay.htm|work=[[About.com]]|publisher=[[The New York Times Company]]|accessdate=December 15, 2012|date=November 1, 2011}}</ref> Banus said "To be completely denied by him in this way is definitely going to make her feel like something is wrong with her."<ref name="On Gay SL" /> She also stated "Gabi loves Will. Before they were ever boyfriend and girlfriend, they were best friends, who were there for each other."<ref name="On Gay SL">{{cite web|last=Di Lauro|first=Janet|title=Camila Banus Torn over the End of Days of Our Lives' Will and Gabi|url=http://daysofourlives.about.com/b/2011/11/15/camila-banus-torn-over-the-end-of-days-of-our-lives-will-and-gabi.htm|work=[[About.com|About]]|publisher=[[The New York Times Company]]|accessdate=December 15, 2012|date=November 15, 2011}}</ref> It was then announced by ''Days of our Lives'' that Will would come out as gay. Banus looked forward to playing the "fallout", and said "For me there are so many questions [...] How is Gabi going to react? Is she going to turn to somebody [else]? Is she going to break up with Will? Is he going to go behind her back? So many things could happen that could affect Gabi, her brother, Sami ... It's going to be an amazing storyline."<ref name="On Gay SL" /> Previewing Gabi's reaction, the actress said: "I feel like when it happens she is going to understand what it was. She is going to go through all those occasions where she felt something weird between them and know what it was. Obviously she will feel hurt because she's invested a lot."<ref name="GW" /> The couple eventually parted ways.<ref name="SDI" />
Banus said that Gabi knew things weren't "completely 100 percent" during their relationship despite the fact that she loves and cares for him. She explained that "when they do break up and he comes out to her, she always honestly feels like everything is her fault. And she blames herself for a lot of things."<ref name="SDI" /> Chandler said "Will loves her as well. There is just no sexual/physical attraction." Prior, viewers picked up on the fact that Will's lack of physical connection with her became one of Gabi's "minor obsessions". Banus joked that his affection was "all she wants". Chandler noted that "There's no doubt Will loves Gabi [...] It's just not in the 'let's get freaky' way".<ref name="GW">{{cite web|last=Dallman|first=William|title=Day of Days 2011: An Interview With Chandler Massey & Camila Banus|url=http://tvsourcemagazine.com/interviews/television/2221-day-of-days-2011-an-interview-with-chandler-massey-a-camila-banus|work=TVSource Magazine|publisher=SoSource Media|accessdate=December 15, 2012|date=June 25, 2012}}</ref> Additionally, the actor felt that the show "didn't drop the dynamic" of the couple after he came out, but it became "more powerful".<ref>{{cite web|last=Fairman|first=Michael|title=Chandler Massey & Camila Banus Interview – A Day of DAYS 2011|url=http://michaelfairmansoaps.com/days-of-our-lives/chandler-massey-camila-banus-interview-a-day-of-days-2011/2011/11/12/|work=On-Air On-Soaps|publisher=Michael Fairman Soaps, Inc.|accessdate=December 15, 2012|date=November 12, 2011}}</ref>
=== Nick Fallon and pregnancy === In August 2012, Will and Gabi both ended up having "a bad week" and have sex, despite him previously announcing he was gay.<ref>{{cite web|last=Di Lauro|first=Janet|title=Days of Our Lives' Will and Gabi Have Sex|url=http://daysofourlives.about.com/b/2012/08/20/days-of-our-lives-will-and-gabi-have-sex.htm|work=[[About.com|About]]|publisher=[[The New York Times Company]]|accessdate=December 15, 2012|date=August 20, 2012}}</ref> Nothing developed from this.<ref name="SC" /> Following her ordeal with Will, Banus said "Gabi needs a man. It’s really important. If she doesn’t get a man soon, she’s going to go ballistic. It needs to be somebody that she doesn’t choose, but they choose her."<ref name="BI" /> It was announced that [[Blake Berris]] would return as former "braniac" [[Nick Fallon]] who was just let out of [[prison]].<ref name="NICKGAB" /> Banus said that if he was paired with Gabi, they could be "crazy together".<ref name="BI" /> Nick and Gabi eventually inched closer and quickly began a romance in October 2012.<ref name="SC" /> During an interview with ''[[Soap Opera Digest]]'', Banus explained their relationship: "Since both Gabi and Nick were in such dark places in their lives, they don't trust what is happening to them... There's a part of them that feels, I'm not good enough to have this happen."<ref name="NICKGAB" /> Berris said: "Camila is very funny, and I'm not sure she gets to play that often on screen."<ref name="NICKGAB">{{cite web|last=Di Lauro|first=Janet|title=Days' Blake Berris and Camila Banus Tell All|url=http://daysofourlives.about.com/b/2012/11/19/days-blake-berris-and-camila-banus-tell-all.htm|work=[[About.com|About]]|publisher=[[The New York Times Company]]|accessdate=December 15, 2012|date=November 19, 2012}}</ref> Additionally, Berris said of the pairing: "I love Camila. She’s awesome, and Nick and Gabi are an interesting pairing. Both characters have gone through so much. I like how slowly they built [the relationship]. Nick was almost freaked out about what would happen to him, if he got involved with somebody."<ref>{{cite web|last=Di Lauro|first=Janet|title=Blake Berris Interview|url=http://daysofourlives.about.com/od/ActorInterviews/a/Blake-Berris-Interview.htm|work=[[About.com|About]]|publisher=[[The New York Times Company]]|accessdate=December 15, 2012}}</ref>
That November, Gabi received shocking news that she was pregnant. Janet Di Lauro of [[About.com]] said "Let's face it. It's a move viewers saw coming, after a down-and-out Gabi shared a night of passion with her gay ex, Will."<ref>{{cite web|last=Di Lauro|first=Janet|title=Days of Our Lives' Gabi Is Pregnant!|url=http://daysofourlives.about.com/b/2012/11/12/days-of-our-lives-gabi-is-pregnant.htm|work=[[About.com|About]]|publisher=[[The New York Times Company]]|accessdate=December 15, 2012|date=November 12, 2012}}</ref> Gabi nearly had an [[abortion]] but decided to go ahead with the pregnancy.<ref>{{cite web|last=Hernandez|first=Greg|title=Days of Our Lives: Will and Gabi head to a clinic but can they go through with ending her pregnancy?|url=http://greginhollywood.com/days-of-our-lives-will-and-gabi-head-to-a-clinic-but-can-they-go-through-with-ending-her-pregnancy-77091|work=Greg In Hollywood|publisher=greginhollywood.com|accessdate=December 15, 2012|date=November 23, 2012}}</ref> Despite Will being the unborn baby's biological father, Gabi and Nick convinced Will to let them raise the baby as their own.<ref>{{cite web|last=Kerr |first=Luke |title=Will Gives in to Nick’s Plan on Days of Our Lives |url=http://daytimeconfidential.zap2it.com/2012/12/06/will-gives-in-to-nicks-plan-for-his-child-on-days-of-our-lives |work=[[Zap2It]] |publisher=[[Tribune Media Services]] |accessdate=December 15, 2012 |date=December 6, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121209020723/http://daytimeconfidential.zap2it.com:80/2012/12/06/will-gives-in-to-nicks-plan-for-his-child-on-days-of-our-lives |archivedate=December 9, 2012 |df=mdy }}</ref> He agreed, and they have begun planning their wedding.<ref>{{cite web|last=Kerr |first=Luke |title=Could Will Cause Trouble For Gabi and Nick on Days of Our Lives? |url=http://daytimeconfidential.zap2it.com/2012/12/11/could-will-cause-trouble-for-gabi-and-nick-on-days-of-our-lives |work=[[Zap2It]] |publisher=[[Tribune Media Services]] |accessdate=December 15, 2012 |date=December 11, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130113042030/http://daytimeconfidential.zap2it.com:80/2012/12/11/could-will-cause-trouble-for-gabi-and-nick-on-days-of-our-lives |archivedate=January 13, 2013 |df=mdy }}</ref> The wedding didn't happen since Will revealed he's the father of Gabi's baby. She and Nick get married in March 2013 and she gave birth to her daughter, Arianna Grace Horton in May 2013.
When Nick plots to remove Will from Arianna's life and become her primary guardian, Gabi and Nick have a physical altercation in which Gabi strikes him with a rock to keep him from raping her, "killing" him (or so she believes). Sami and Kate help Gabi dump him in the river in which he wakes up before believing he drowned. However, he returns continues to blackmail Gabi until the character was killed in a [[whodunit]] murder mystery.
== Storylines ==
===2009–14=== Gabriella Josephina Hernandez is born in 1992 or 1993 in Salem, Illinois.<ref>Arianna Horton's birth certificate list Gabi's full name, Gabriella Josephina Hernandez, age, 20, and apparently place of birth as Salem. June 5, 2013.</ref><ref>Camila Banus listed Gabi's name as Gabriela Josefina Hernandez on Twitter. June 26, 2013.</ref> She is the younger sister of Rafe, the late Arianna, and Dario Hernandez. Rafe and Arianna felt that they were being stalked while at the Brady pub, but were shocked to find out that Gabi had come to Salem and was spying on them. Initially for her winter break, Gabi decided to permanently move to Salem, and moved into a vacant room at the Brady Pub. Arianna and Gabi briefly argued but eventually bonded. She befriended other local teens including Chad Peterson-Woods (later revealed to be Chad DiMera). They briefly dated, but he left her for Mia. Saddened by the break-up, Gabi focused herself fully on school. She befriended Will Horton who attended the Salem High formal as her date. Arianna was killed in a [[hit-and-run]] accident. She leaned on Will for support and they shared their first kiss. The couple's romance deepened as they were there for one another during mutual times of crisis. They slept together, but Gabi noticed that Will didn't want to sleep with her again. He later came out as gay, and they split up. Gabi earned a job at [[Quinn Hudson]]'s (Bren Foster) Intensity Day Spa and developed another crush on Chad, and began scheming to break him and his girlfriend [[Melanie Jonas]] ([[Molly Burnett]]) up. To make Chad worry over her, she pretended to have a stalker, writing fake threatening notes. Chad had Gabi move in with him. So further keep up with her lie, she hired a guy named Andrew to pose as her stalker. Eventually, Andrew's actions became too much and Gabi told him to stop. He ended up kidnapping Melanie, to Gabi's knowledge. Andrew blackmailed Gabi into not telling anybody about Melanie. The truth was eventually revealed, and Chad hated Gabi for it. Feeling down, she ended up having a [[one night stand]] with Will, but agreed that it was a mistake. Chad consistently reminded Gabi that she would continue to pay for what she did. She then began a relationship with Nick, who was released from jail after serving time because he kidnapped Melanie. Nick reassured everyone he was a changed man. Chad assaulted Nick, who promised not to press charges if Chad dropped his threats towards Gabi, which he did. Gabi and Nick began planning their happy future, but she realized that she was pregnant with Will's child. Eventually, Gabi, Nick and Will decided that they would pretend that Nick is the father, and Gabi and Nick decided to get married. But when Gabi accidentally let it slip that she is further along than she originally said, Nick covered for her, saying that the two had a one-night stand the day they met. Despite there being some anger at this, everyone has accepted the duo as a couple, except for Chad, who wants Gabi to pay for her misdeeds. Chad told [[Sonny Kiriakis]], Will's boyfriend, about Gabi's role in Melanie's kidnapping. Ever since, Sonny has cut all his ties to Gabi and warned Will to avoid her. On May 20, 2013, Gabi gave birth to a daughter, Arianna Grace Horton, after Gabi's sister and Rafe's deceased goddaughter. Nick finally tells Gabi about what happened to him in prison, and what he did to Will. Gabi moves in with Will, Sonny and baby Arianna and her marriage to Nick is annulled. Despite being divorced, Nick continued to be obsessed with Gabi. When Gabi refused his advances, he tried to rape her. Gabi took a rock and bashed Nick on the head. Sami and Kate arrived and help Gabi throw Nick's body in the water. Nick briefly woke up before sinking into the water, and Gabi was haunted by the fact that they had let him die. On the day of Arianna's christening, Nick showed up at the ceremony alive, and lied about the events that happened that night. Nick wanted to reconcile with Gabi and slowly spent time with her and Arianna. He tried to get Gabi to take Arianna away from Will, but was eventually shot and killed with Gabi revealed to be the shooter. Gabi explained that she was scared of Nick's influence over her and felt she had to kill him to stop him from being a threat to Arianna. She also admitted her role in Melanie's kidnapping and told Marlena about her, Kate and Sami throwing Nick in the river. EJ, who served as Gabi's lawyer, thought it would be better for her to have a plea deal than go to trial and have the truth about Melanie's kidnapping come out. Gabi accepted the plea deal and got ten to twenty years in prison.
Gabi is visited by Rafe and later on by Will, Sonny and Arianna for the holidays. She gets another visitor, but it's Melanie, instead of Will and Sonny, who forgave Gabi her past decisions.
===2015–=== Gabi is released from prison in September 2015 and shares a happy reunion with Rafe, Will and Arianna thanks to an error made in her sentencing. As Gabi settles back into her life and relaunches her modeling career when Kate hires her at ''Basic Black'' working opposite retired baseball player [[Paul Narita]] ([[Christopher Sean]]), she is devastated when Will is murdered by a serial killer. The killings lead to Gabi's reunion with her estranged father Eduardo ([[A Martinez]]) for the first time since she was an infant as one of the serial killer victims is Gabi's half-sister [[Paige Larson|Paige]] ([[True O'Brien]]). Gabi bonds with [[JJ Deveraux]] ([[Casey Moss]]) and in December 2015, they begin dating.
== Reception == Janet Di Lauro of [[About.com]] said that the character is crazy and "naughty."<ref name="BI" /> Of being the only [[Hispanic]] during her time on ''Days of Our Lives'', Banus stated in 2012: "I’m definitely grateful. I’m proud be a Latina, and I’m really proud to represent for all the Latinas out there; especially the young Latina women. It’s important for them to have a role. I feel really empowered to be the young Latina on the show, and I have no problem carrying all of the responsibility on my back."<ref name="BI">{{cite web|last=Di Lauro|first=Janet|title=Camila Banus Interview|url=http://daysofourlives.about.com/od/ActorInterviews/a/Camila-Banus-Interview.htm|work=[[About.com|About]]|publisher=[[The New York Times Company]]|accessdate=December 15, 2012}}</ref> Banus' portrayal of Gabi earned her a nomination for [[Daytime Emmy Award for Outstanding Younger Actress in a Drama Series|Outstanding Younger Actress in a Drama Series]] at the [[42nd Daytime Emmy Awards]] in 2015.<ref>{{cite web|title=The 42nd Annual Daytime Emmy Award Nominations |url=http://cdn.emmyonline.org/day_42nd_nominations.pdf |publisher=emmyonline.org and [[National Academy of Television Arts and Sciences]] |accessdate=March 31, 2015 |date=March 31, 2015 |format=PDF |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/6XRjz10wi?url=http://cdn.emmyonline.org/day_42nd_nominations.pdf |archivedate=March 31, 2015 |location=[[New York City]] |deadurl=yes |df=mdy }}</ref>

'''Gabriel Arturo Garza Hoth''' (born [[Mexico]], ?) also known as "The Black Widower", was a Mexican [[serial killer]] active between 1991 and 1998 in [[Mexico City]]. He collected life insurance payments on his wife and lovers, <ref>{{cite book |last=Newton |first=Michael |title=The Encyclopedia of Serial Killers |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=DwNVbOcTncwC&pg=PA346&dq=gabriel+garza+hoth&hl=es-419&sa=X&ei=BBF0UoboJKKsjALeloGIAw&ved=0CDUQ6AEwAA |location=New York, USA |publisher=Facts On File, Inc. |isbn=0-8160-6195-5 |accessdate=November 2, 2013 }}</ref> gaining a total of 500,000 dollars.<ref>{{cite news |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=September 1, 2000 |title=Las ganancias del Viudo Negro |url=http://edant.clarin.com/diario/2000/01/09/e-05802d.htm |newspaper=El Clarín |location=Mexico |publisher= |accessdate=November 2, 2013 }}</ref>
His first victim was his first wife, named Soledad Valdez, who had a heart attack and died in 1991, but the doctors believed that maybe she had been poisoned. His second victim was his girlfriend named Marcela Palacios, who died in 1992 in a "violent assault". The final victim was Ana Gloria Gomezpalacio who died in another "assault". <ref>{{cite news |last=Martínez |first=Fabiola |last2=Baltazar |first2=Elia |last3=Galán |first3=José |date=September 1, 2000 |title=El Viudo Negro, consignado en el Reclusorio Oriente |url=http://www.jornada.unam.mx/2000/01/08/cap4.html |newspaper=La Jornada |location=Mexico |publisher= |accessdate=November 2, 2013 }}</ref> The coincidences were alerted to the police, but Garza escaped to [[Spain]]. He was captured in 1998 and extradited to Mexico, where he was condemned to life in prison.

{{Infobox person | name = Gabriel Paul Hall | image = | image_size = | caption = | birth_name = Gabriel Espinosa-Cañada | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1993|02|18}} | birth_place = [[Cebu City]], [[Philippines]] | criminal_charge = Murder of Edwin Shaar, Jr. | nationality = [[Filipino American]] }}
'''Gabriel Espinosa Cañada Hall''',<ref name=FALDEFteamback>"[http://www.filipinoreporter.us/home/filipino-american/2125-faldef-team-back-from-cebu.html FALDEF team back from Cebu]." ''[[Filipino Reporter]]''. Sunday October 21, 2012. Retrieved on January 28, 2015.</ref> also known as '''Gabriel Paul Hall''' or '''Paul Gabriel Hall''' (born February 18, 1993<ref name=TDCJprofile>"[http://tdcj.state.tx.us/death_row/dr_info/hallpaul.html Hall, Paul Gabriel]." [[Texas Department of Criminal Justice]]. Retrieved on January 28, 2016.</ref>) is a Filipino adoptee and convicted murderer residing in Texas.
Hall originated from [[Cebu City]] and resided in the Children’s Shelter of Cebu for six years.<ref name=DeLaTorreAJ>De La Torre, AJ. "[http://www.philstar.com/cebu-news/2013/07/18/984001/over-killing-retired-professor-cebuano-faces-death-texas Over killing of retired professor Cebuano faces death in Texas ]." ''[[The Freeman (newspaper)|The Freeman]]''. July 18, 2013/ Retrieved on January 28, 2016.</ref> His original family name was Espinosa-Cañada.<ref name=WalkerBioSis>Walker, Jake. "[http://www.theeagle.com/news/gabriel_hall/gabriel-hall-s-biological-sister-testifies-about-adoptive-household/article_79e6def4-6b8d-11e5-9098-dbe1ad8de06e.html Gabriel Hall's biological sister testifies about adoptive household]." ''[[The Bryan-College Station Eagle|The Eagle]]''. Tuesday October 6, 2015. Retrieved on January 28, 2016.</ref> Wes Hall and Karen Kruse Hall adopted him when he was age 11.<ref name=DeLaTorreAJ/> Wes Hall is a former attorney and [[Brazos County, Texas|Brazos County]] justice of the peace, and Karen Hall was the president of the Central Texas Orphan Mission.<ref name=FALDEFteamback/> The Halls had adopted multiple children,<ref name=Kielymurdertrialdelayedyear>Kiely, Maggie. "[http://www.theeagle.com/news/local/hall-murder-trial-could-be-delayed-up-to-a-year/article_651f7fbb-3a13-5599-b65b-78076fd841e9.html Hall murder trial could be delayed up to a year]." ''[[The Bryan-College Station Eagle|The Eagle]]'' (Bryan-College Station). Wednesday August 28, 2013. Retrieved on January 28, 2016.</ref> including Hall's biological sister, Eralyn.<ref name=WalkerBioSis/> Prior to the murder Gabriel Hall attended [[A&M Consolidated High School]].<ref name=Kielymurdertrialdelayedyear/>
Hall's biological father, Eduardo Cañada, Sr.,<ref name=ArrivesDR>"[http://www.kbtx.com/home/headlines/Click-Here-To-Access-Real-Time-Updates-Of-Gabriel-Hall-Murder-Trial-325505331.html Gabriel Hall Arrives At Texas Death Row]." ''[[KBTX-TV]]''. Friday October 9, 2015. Updated Wednesday January 6, 2016. Retrieved on January 28, 2016.</ref> resident in the Philippines, is a convicted murderer.<ref name=WalkerJakeWhatyouneed>Walker, Jake. "[http://www.theeagle.com/blogs/jake_walker/what-you-need-to-know-about-the-gabriel-hall-trial/article_76f56210-4d10-11e5-83dc-af74f542404e.html What you need to know about the Gabriel Hall trial in 5 minutes]." ''[[The Bryan-College Station Eagle|The Eagle]]''. Friday August 28, 2015. Retrieved on January 28, 2016.</ref>
==Murder, trial, and criminal penalty== [[File:PolunskyUnitWestLivingstonTX.jpg|thumb|[[Polunsky Unit]], where Hall is incarcerated]] On October 20, 2011, Hall murdered 68-year-old Edwin Shaar, Jr., a former professor at [[Texas A&M University]], and injured the man's wife, 69-year-old Linda Shaar, in their [[College Station, Texas|College Station]] residence.<ref name=WalkerJakeWhatyouneed/> Hall had never previously met either person.<ref name=Kielymurdertrialdelayedyear/> Hall stabbed and shot the former professor in his garage.<ref name=WalkerJakeWhatyouneed/> Hall slit the throat of the wife, who was in a wheelchair, and left her; she called [[9-1-1]] and survived.<ref name=GMAFALDEF>"[http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/271489/news/pinoyabroad/legal-team-heads-to-dallas-to-help-pinoy-facing-death-sentence-for-murder Legal team heads to Dallas to help Pinoy facing death sentence for murder]." [[GMA News]]. Retrieved on January 28, 2016.</ref> On December 21, 2011, a grand jury indicted Hall for capital murder.<ref name=FALDEFteamback/>
[[Filipino American Legal Defense and Education Fund]] (FALDEF) aided Hall in his legal efforts.<ref name=GMAFALDEF/> His murder trial was scheduled to begin on October 21, 2013. Jarvis Parsons, the Brazos County district attorney, prosecuted Hall and sought the death penalty. His first assistant was Brian Baker. Hall had multiple attorneys, including Tony Odiorne. His defense team organized a trip to the Philippines as part of the defense.<ref>"[http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/317831/news/pinoyabroad/texas-lawyers-trying-to-save-22-year-old-fil-am-facing-death-penalty Texas lawyers trying to save 22-year-old Fil-Am facing death penalty]." ''[[GMA News]]''. July 17, 2013. Retrieved on January 28, 2015.</ref> FALDEF persons later traveled to Texas to assist Hall.<ref>* "[http://www.filipinoreporter.us/home/filipino-american/2030-filipino-legal-team-off-to-texas-to-help-adoptee-on-death-row.html Filipino legal team off to Texas to help adoptee on death row]." ''[[Filipino Reporter]]''. Sunday August 26, 2012. Retrieved on January 28, 2016.</ref>
Hall was convicted and sentenced to death. On October 9, 2015, Hall, [[Texas Department of Criminal Justice]](TDCJ)#999599, arrived at the Texas [[death row]] for men,<ref name=TDCJprofile/> located at the [[Allan B. Polunsky Unit]].<ref name=ArrivesDR/> He was the first Texas death row inmate received in 2015.<ref>Graczyk, Michael. "[http://bigstory.ap.org/article/aeb72360137e4613b503a0d30dce54ba/convicted-killer-heads-death-row-1st-texas-2015 Death row in Texas gets its first new inmate of the year]." [[Associated Press]]. October 9, 2015. Retrieved on January 28, 2016.</ref>

{{DISPLAYTITLE:Gabrielle (''Xena: Warrior Princess'')}} {{Primary sources|date=February 2012}} {{Infobox character | name = Gabrielle | color = #87CEFA | image = [[Image:Gabby Xena.jpg|250px|alt=A young blonde woman wearing a green woven tank-top and leather skirt. She holds a wooden fighting staff, a horse can be seen in the background.|
'''''Gabrielle, in the Season 2'''''
]] [[Renée O'Connor]] as '''Gabrielle''' | first = [[Sins of the Past (Xena episode)|Sins of the Past]] | last = A Friend in Need, part 2 | creator = [[Robert Tapert]] | occupation = [[Warrior]], [[Bard]] | species = Human | portrayer = [[Renee O'Connor]] | lbl21 = Affiliation | data21 = [[Xena]], [[Hope (Xena)|Hope]], [[Lila (Xena)|Lila]], [[Joxer]], [[Eli (Xena)|Eli]], [[Perdicas]], the [[Amazons]] }} '''Gabrielle''' is a [[fictional character]] played by [[Renee O'Connor]] in the American fantasy TV series ''[[Xena: Warrior Princess]]'' (1995-2001). She is referred to by fans as the Battling [[Bard]] of [[Potidaea]].{{Citation needed|date=February 2012}} Her trademark weapons are the [[Amazons|Amazon]] [[Quarterstaff|fighting staff]] and later, the [[sai (weapon)|sais]]. She was also an [[Amazons|Amazon]] [[Princess]] and later an [[Amazons|Amazon]] [[Queen regnant|Queen]]. The character's development and progression is a story that spans the entire show's run, with her first appearance in "Sins of the Past" seeing her as a naive farm girl, and the final episode, "A Friend In Need (Part 2)" seeing her as a fully formed but rational warrior, set to follow in the deceased Xena's footsteps. The dwarf planet [[Eris (dwarf planet)|Eris]] and its moon [[Dysnomia (moon)|Dysnomia]] had the interim names "Xena" and "Gabrielle" until they were officially named.{{Cite web | title=Xena and Gabrielle |date=January 2006 | work=Status | url=http://www.aas.org/cswa/status/Status_Jan06.pdf |format=PDF| accessdate=2007-05-03}} She was listed in [[AfterEllen.com]]'s Top 50 Favorite Female TV Characters.{{cite web|title=AfterEllen.com's Top 50 Favorite Female TV Characters |url=http://www.afterellen.com/content/2012/02/afterellencoms-top-50-favorite-female-tv-characters?page=0%2C6 |publisher=AfterEllen.com |accessdate=June 24, 2012 |date=February 27, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120714044627/http://www.afterellen.com/content/2012/02/afterellencoms-top-50-favorite-female-tv-characters?page=0%2C6 |archivedate=July 14, 2012 |df= }} == Creation and production== O'Connor was chosen to play the role after she impressed producers with her performance in the ''[[Hercules: The Legendary Journeys|Hercules]]'' [[television movie]] ''[[Hercules and the Lost Kingdom|The Lost Kingdom]]''. In the two musical episodes,{{cite episode|title=The Bitter Suite|series=Xena: Warrior Princess|serieslink=Xena: Warrior Princess|airdate=1998-02-02}}{{cite episode|title=Lyre, Lyre, Hearts on Fire|series=Xena: Warrior Princess|serieslink=Xena: Warrior Princess|airdate=2000-01-17}} Gabrielle's singing voice was mainly provided by Susan Wood.[http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0940020/ Susan Wood on the IMDB] (This may be because in another brief musical portion of the fourth season episode "If the Shoe Fits..", Renee O'Connor's voice sounded like that of an opera singer.) In the episode "[[Lyre, Lyre, Hearts on Fire]]", O'Connor sang the chorus in "War" and the rap lead in "Gettin' Ready". ''Gabrielle'' is the [[French language|French]] feminine form of the [[given name]] [[Gabriel]], the [[Archangel]], from the [[Hebrew]] meaning "messenger of God". The Greek transliteration of "Gabrielle" would be Γαβριέλα, (Gavriela).{{cite web|url=http://whoosh.org/issue79/reams3.html|title=A Woman of Deception: Gabrielle???!|publisher=Whoosh.org|accessdate=2007-05-16}}{{Verify credibility|date=February 2012}} In Xena Italian dub, the character was renamed "Olimpia". ==Character history== ===From farm girl to warrior=== When Gabrielle first meets [[Xena]], she is a farm girl living in the village of [[Potidaea]]. She and her sister, [[Lila (Xena)|Lila]], along with several other village girls, have been kidnapped by the men of the warlord, [[Draco (Xena)|Draco]], to be sold as [[slavery|slaves]]. Xena intervenes and rescues them. Awed by her fighting skills, Gabrielle decides that she wants to become a warrior too. She also wants to avoid the marriage that her parents, Herodotus and Hecuba, have arranged for her with her childhood friend [[Perdicas]]. Gabrielle insists on following an initially reluctant Xena on the road.{{cite episode|title=Sins of the Past|series=Xena: Warrior Princess|serieslink=Xena: Warrior Princess|airdate=1995-09-04}} The two women soon develop a strong bond of love and friendship; by the sixth season it is heavily implied that this relationship has become romantic.{{cite web|url=http://dir.salon.com/story/ent/feature/2005/09/15/xena/index.html?pn=2|title= What we owe Xena|accessdate=2 January 2007 |last=Young |first=Cathy |date=15 September 2005 |work=Salon.com}} Over the six years of the series, Gabrielle evolves from a naive, idealistic young woman into a fully fledged, but deeply conflicted, warrior fighting alongside Xena.{{Or|date=February 2012}} ===The Battling Bard of Potidaea=== Gabrielle starts the series as a young adult who more or less stands behind Xena, and relies on Xena to protect her. Later on in the series, she acquires a fighting staff from the Greek [[Amazons]]{{cite episode|title=Hooves and Harlots|series=Xena: Warrior Princess|serieslink=Xena: Warrior Princess|airdate=1995-11-20}} and starts to use it as both a defensive and offensive weapon, displaying some skill in using the staff.{{cite episode|title=Beware Greeks Bearing Gifts|series=Xena: Warrior Princess|serieslink=Xena: Warrior Princess|airdate=1996-01-15}} As the series goes on, Gabrielle's skills with the staff continue to develop. In one episode, Gabrielle takes on numerous soldiers and single-handedly attempts to rescue Xena's presumed dead body.{{cite episode|title=The Greater Good|series=Xena: Warrior Princess|serieslink=Xena: Warrior Princess|airdate=1996-05-06}} Two episodes later she is seen blocking an arrow in flight with her staff.{{cite episode|title=Death Mask|series=Xena: Warrior Princess|serieslink=Xena: Warrior Princess|airdate=1996-06-03}} Later on, Gabrielle also adds kicks and minor [[acrobatics]] to her fighting abilities. Under the tutelage of [[Xena]], she becomes worthy of many foes. While in [[India]], Gabrielle is thrown through time by a Darsham to save Xena's soul. It is said that [[reincarnation|their souls are together throughout time]].{{cite episode|title=Between the Lines|series=Xena: Warrior Princess|serieslink=Xena: Warrior Princess|airdate=1999-02-15}} In this next life Xena is the Mother of Peace, Arminestra and Gabrielle is Shakti, a Warrior Prince of [[India]]. At the end of season 4, Gabrielle shows a leap in her warrior abilities. After months of following her path of the Way of Love,{{cite episode|title=The Way|series=Xena: Warrior Princess|serieslink=Xena: Warrior Princess|airdate=1999-02-22}} Gabrielle picks up the sword of a paralyzed Xena and fights off a large group of Roman soldiers, killing several of them.{{cite episode|title=The Ides of March|series=Xena: Warrior Princess|serieslink=Xena: Warrior Princess|airdate=1999-05-10}} By season 5, Gabrielle starts to fight with her [[Sai (weapon)|sai]],{{cite episode|title=Chakram|series=Xena: Warrior Princess|serieslink=Xena: Warrior Princess|airdate=1999-10-04}} incorporating more acrobatic abilities, such as performing a wall run and back flip.{{cite episode|title=Animal Attraction|series=Xena: Warrior Princess|serieslink=Xena: Warrior Princess|airdate=1999-10-18}} In addition to sai and sometimes a new casual staff, she can use a large array of weapons with proficiency. Gabrielle also fights against warriors with notable skill; she defeats the warrior Mavican{{cite episode|title=Succession|series=Xena: Warrior Princess|serieslink=Xena: Warrior Princess|airdate=1999-10-11}} and stands against Ares and [[Hades]] (two gods) in battle for a period of time, before they defeat her. She also fights in a sword duel with Brutus, [[Caesar_(Xena:_Warrior_Princess)|Caesar's]] former right hand and one of the leaders of Rome, eventually killing him.{{cite episode|title=Antony and Cleopatra|series=Xena: Warrior Princess|serieslink=Xena: Warrior Princess|airdate=2000-04-24}} Gabrielle's abilities throughout the series are noticed by the God of War who seeks her out as his new [[protégée]]. It is mentioned later by Gabrielle that Xena trained her throughout the years, although there have only been a few episodes that actually show Xena giving her any sort of martial arts training. One of Gabrielle's biggest fights in the series is her fight against fellow Amazon queen, [[Varia (Xena)|Varia]]. They fight in an enclosed arena in a match in which Eve's life is at stake, and they appeared to be at a stand-off before she is beaten by Varia.{{cite episode|title=Path of Vengeance|series=Xena: Warrior Princess|serieslink=Xena: Warrior Princess|airdate=2001-02-17}} Gabrielle takes the loss graciously and continues to grow in skill over the remaining season. ==Characterization== Gabrielle's bardic skills appear to be natural and self-taught.{{or|date=February 2012}} In the opening episode, she displays a remarkable ability to talk her way out of fearsome or difficult situations: she talks a [[cyclops]] out of eating her, and makes an ally of him; talks an old man into giving her a lift; talks a violent crowd out of killing Xena; and talks her way into joining Xena as her traveling partner. Besides her persuasive ability, she also reads and writes - rare skills for that time, loves to tell stories, and has some musical ability. As she travels with Xena, she records their adventures on a series of scrolls, with an eye for flair and drama. Occasionally her tendency to exaggerate and glamorize the facts gets her into trouble.{{cite episode|title=The Quill Is Mightier...|series=Xena: Warrior Princess|serieslink=Xena: Warrior Princess|airdate=}} She is also shown telling stories for money in an inn. In other episodes she wins a place in the Athens City Academy for Performing Bards,{{cite episode|title=Athens City Academy of the Performing Bards|series=Xena: Warrior Princess|serieslink=Xena: Warrior Princess|airdate=}} is a famous playwright, is a theatrical director,{{cite episode|title=The Play's The Thing|series=Xena: Warrior Princess|serieslink=Xena: Warrior Princess|airdate=}} plays the [[Pan flute|pan pipes]] with considerable skill,{{cite episode|title=The Prodigal|series=Xena: Warrior Princess|serieslink=Xena: Warrior Princess|airdate=}} and is the only person able to recite a magical scroll with the correct accents.{{cite episode|title=The Titans|series=Xena: Warrior Princess|serieslink=Xena: Warrior Princess|airdate=}} Despite Gabrielle's ascendancy as a warrior (in the episode "The Ides of March" she slew nine Roman legionaries), her role as a bard remains important. About a year into her travels with Xena, her scrolls about Xena's exploits begin to gain popularity, apparently helping, according to Ares, turn Xena into a legend. After their 25-year sleep, Gabrielle finds out that her stories had been read as far away as North Africa where they were popular among nomad tribes.{{cite episode|title=Legacy|series=Xena: Warrior Princess|serieslink=Xena: Warrior Princess|airdate=2000-10-30}} According to an episode set in modern times, Gabrielle's scrolls were preserved for thousands of years and discovered during [[World War II]] by modern archeologists who were descendants of Xena, Gabrielle, and [[Joxer]]. The scrolls found their way to Hollywood, where they formed the basis of the television series. This leads into an entire small story-arc in which the modern-day reincarnations of Xena, Gabrielle and Joxer meet and interact. Xena and Gabrielle's reincarnations pair up to make their own names for themselves, instead of living in their father's shadows. Joxer's reincarnation is a fan of the show.{{cite episode|title=The Xena Scrolls|series=Xena: Warrior Princess|serieslink=Xena: Warrior Princess|airdate=1997-01-13}} ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== *{{imdb character|26645|Gabrielle}} {{xenaverse}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Gabrielle}} [[Category:Xena: Warrior Princess characters]] [[Category:Female action heroes]] [[Category:Fictional characters introduced in 1995]] [[Category:Fictional ancient people]] [[Category:Fictional acrobats]] [[Category:Fictional composers]] [[Category:Fictional Greek people]] [[Category:Fictional historians]] [[Category:Fictional filicides]] [[Category:Fictional LGBT characters in television]] [[Category:Fictional oral poets]] [[Category:Fictional panpipers]] [[Category:Fictional princesses]] [[Category:Fictional queens]] [[Category:Fictional stick-fighters]] [[Category:Fictional women soldiers and warriors]] [[Category:Fictional writers]] [[Category:Television sidekicks]]

The story revolves around the life of [[serial killer]] [[John Wayne Gacy]]. ==Plot== {{expand section|date=May 2015}} [[John Wayne Gacy]] ([[Mark Holton]]) seemed to be a model citizen. He even volunteered as a clown for the children at the local hospital, but he kept a gruesome secret. A trail of missing young men led to Gacy's suburban home. The nation watched in horror as, one by one, the details of over 30 murders came to light and most of the victims, entombed in the crawl space underneath his house, were unearthed. John Wayne Gacy had been one of the most infamous killers in the whole country. ==Cast== * [[Mark Holton]] (Scott Alan Henry, young) as [[John Wayne Gacy|John Wayne Gacy, Jr.]] * [[Adam Baldwin]] as composite of two young men who had lived with Gacy in reality. ==Reception== {{expand section|date=May 2015}} On the film review aggregate website [[Rotten Tomatoes]], ''Gacy'' received a 17% approval '''Gaheris''' {{IPAc-en|ɡ|ə|ˈ|h|ɛr|ᵻ|s}} (Old French: Gaheriet or Gaheriez<ref>Spelling varies according to sources and declension. In the [[Old French]] ''La Mort le roi Artu'': "Gaheriet" in the [[oblique case]], "Gaheriez" in the [[nominative case]] (Jean Frappier, ed., ''La Mort le roi Artu'', Paris: Droz, 1996, p.291. ISBN 2600001832).</ref>) is a character in the [[Arthurian legend]], a nephew of [[King Arthur]] and a [[Knight of the Round Table]], the third son of Arthur's sister or half-sister [[Morgause]] and her husband [[Lot (Arthurian legend)|Lot]], King of [[Orkney]] and [[Lothian]]. He is the younger brother of [[Gawain]] and [[Agravaine]], and the older brother of [[Gareth]] and half-brother of [[Mordred]].<ref>An enumeration of the four brothers (excluding Mordred) can be found in [[Chrétien de Troyes]]'s ''[[Perceval, the Story of the Grail]]'' when Gawain tells the "white-haired queen" (his grandmother [[Igraine]]) the names of the four brothers ("Gawain is the oldest, the second Agravain the Proud [...], Gaheriet and Guerehet are the names of the following two." (verses 8139-8142 in the Dufournet edition; verses 8056-8060 in the Méla edition)); a brief portrait of the five brothers (including Mordred) can be found in the prose ''Lancelot'' (see: Norris J. Lacy, ed., ''Lancelot-Grail: Lancelot Parts III and IV'', Volume 4 of ''Lancelot-Grail: The Old French Arthurian Vulgate and Post-Vulgate in Translation'', Boydell & Brewer Ltd, 2010, pp. 392-4. ISBN 9781843842354.)</ref>
Gaheris is mentioned in [[Chrétien de Troyes]]'s ''[[Perceval, the Story of the Grail]]''.<ref>See above.</ref> Several of his adventures are narrated in the ''[[Lancelot-Grail]]'' cycle. In the prose ''Lancelot'', he is described as valiant, agile, handsome, reticent in speech, prone to excess when angered, and possessing a right arm longer than the left.<ref>''Ibid''.</ref> His death at the hands of [[Lancelot]] (during Lancelot's rescue of the queen from being burned at the stake) is related in the ''Death of Arthur'', the final volume of the cycle.<ref>Norris J. Lacy, ed. and trans., ''Lancelot-Grail: The Death of Arthur'', Volume 7 of ''Lancelot-Grail: The Old French Arthurian Vulgate and Post-Vulgate in Translation'', Boydell & Brewer Ltd, 2010, p. 69-70. ISBN 9780859917704.</ref> The ''Lancelot'' and the ''Death of Arthur'' sections of the ''Lancelot-Grail'' cycle differ in their characterization of Gaheris. In the ''Lancelot'', his younger brother Guerrehet/Gareth is Gawain's most cherished brother; in the ''Death of Arthur'', Gaheris is represented as the most cherished, and his death anguishes Gawain profoundly.<ref>Norris J. Lacy, ed., ''Lancelot-Grail: Lancelot Parts III and IV'', pp. 393-4.</ref>
The character of Gaheris appears in the ''[[Post-Vulgate Cycle]]'' and [[Thomas Malory]]'s ''[[Le Morte d'Arthur]]'', as well as in other media related to the Arthurian legend.
== Gaheris in Malory == In [[Thomas Malory]]'s ''[[Le Morte d'Arthur]]'', Gaheris is [[squire]] to his elder brother Gawain, whose fiery temper he helps moderate, before being knighted himself. He participates in the [[revenge killing]] of [[Pellinore|King Pellinore]], his father's slayer, and [[Lamorak|Sir Lamorak]], Pellinore's son and his mother's lover. More notorious is his [[beheading]] of his own mother Morgause after catching her [[in flagrante delicto]] with the youthful and handsome Lamorak, who meanwhile escapes. Lamorak is hunted down by all of the brothers except Gareth, believing him to be their mother's murderer, and Mordred stabs him in the back. Lamorak is greater than any knight except [[Lancelot]] and [[Tristan|Tristram]], so the Orkney brothers' act of revenge is deemed cowardly and a blot on their honour. Arthur and the brothers discover that Gaheris is Morgause's slayer, and he is banished from court.
Despite being exiled, Gaheris appears later in the narrative, when he and his brother Gareth are accidentally killed by [[Lancelot]] during the rescue of [[Guinevere]]. Gaheris and Gareth will have nothing to do with Agravaine and Mordred's plot to entrap Lancelot and Guinevere, and Arthur asks the brothers to help guard the Queen's execution. Gaheris and Gareth reluctantly agree, though Gawain refuses. They decline to wear armor; Lancelot is unable to distinguish friend from foe in his blind wrath, and rushes to save the woman whom he loves. He unintentionally cuts down the unarmored princes. When he is later told what happened, Lancelot is emotionally anguished, because he loved Gareth almost like a son. Gawain's fury at this outrage is terrible and the resulting feud largely destroys the Round Table.
== Analysis == Gaheris is often little more than a supporting character to his brothers [[Gawain]] and [[Gareth]], with the murder of Morgause an odd exception{{citation needed|date=August 2014}}, leading modern authors such as [[T. H. White]] to attribute the act of matricide to [[Agravaine]] instead. White gives his own individual interpretation to the story, depicting Agravaine as having an unhealthy love/lust obsession for his own mother, and repeatedly describes Gaheris as "dull" or "dull-witted". Gaheris even marries the sister of Gareth's wife Lyonors, the haughty damsel [[Lynette and Lyonesse|Lynette]]. It is likely that Gaheris and Gareth were the same character in origin{{citation needed|date=August 2014}}, as their names in [[French language|French]] sources are easy to confuse (Guerrehet (Gareth, usually) and Gaheriet (Gaheris, usually)), and adventures ascribed to the brothers are often interchangeable. Furthermore, only one brother is ever named for Gwalchmai ap Gwyar, the character from [[Welsh mythology]] traditionally identified with Gawain. This character ([[Gwalchafed]]) is a likely source for Gaheris and Gareth, if Gawain was indeed derived from Gwalchmai.{{citation needed|date=August 2014}}
== In other adaptations==
* In the movie ''[[First Knight]]'' (1995) Gaheris is portrayed by [[Alexis Denisof]].<ref>[[IMDB]], [http://www.imdb.com/character/ch0066846/ "Sir Gaheris (Character)"].</ref> * In [[Gerald Morris]]' ''[[The Squire's Tales]]'', Gaheris is one of the main heroes, a witty, quietly brave man who prefers agriculture to sword fighting.
==See also== * Gaheris, the brother of Gawain, should not be confused with a different character in the ''Death of Arthur'', Gaheris of Karaheu (brother of Mador de la Porte), who is killed by eating a poisoned fruit offered to him (unknowingly) by the queen.<ref>Frappier, pp 75-6, p. 291.</ref>
